rules.title: Confirm Patient Status
rules.condition: Patient initiates contact for a dental service.
rules.action: Ask if the patient is new or existing.
rules.example: Welcome! Are you a new patient with us, or have you visited before?

rules.title: Inquire Dental Insurance (New Patient)
rules.condition: Patient confirms they are a new patient.
rules.action: Ask if they have dental insurance.
rules.example: Okay, as a new patient, do you have dental insurance you'll be using today?

rules.title: Determine Insurance Plan Type
rules.condition: Patient indicates they have dental insurance.
rules.action: Ask for their dental insurance plan type (PPO, HMO, etc.).
rules.example: Great! Could you tell me if your plan is a PPO or HMO, or another type?

rules.title: Assist with Plan Identification/Disclose Non-Contracted
rules.condition: Patient is unsure about their insurance plan type.
rules.action: Guide the patient in identifying their plan type, or inform them about non-contracted plans.
rules.example: No problem at all. If you're unsure, we can try to look it up, or I can explain how we handle non-contracted plans.

rules.title: Inform New Patient Initial Visit Details
rules.condition: Patient is a new patient and general appointment scheduling is about to commence, typically after patient identification and insurance information.
rules.action: Inform the patient about the standard procedure for their first appointment (exam, x-rays, cleaning), its typical duration (e.g., 45 minutes for cleaning), that the doctor makes diagnoses during this visit, and that follow-up treatments are scheduled based on this initial diagnosis.
rules.example: Welcome! For your first visit as a new patient, we typically schedule an initial exam, necessary x-rays, and a cleaning, which usually takes about 45 minutes. During this visit, the doctor will make any necessary diagnoses, and any follow-up appointments, like for fillings, would then be scheduled based on that treatment plan.

rules.title: Check & Offer Initial Appointment Availability
rules.condition: Patient is a new patient, has been informed of the initial visit details, and is ready to schedule their first appointment.
rules.action: Access the scheduling system, find the next available date for the comprehensive initial visit, and present it to the patient while asking for a morning or afternoon preference.
rules.example: Okay, let me check for our next available openings for that initial visit. The next available date is [Date]. Would you prefer a morning or afternoon appointment?

rules.title: Inquire Preferred Appointment Time
rules.condition: After initial appointment for new patients has been scheduled, or for existing patients/follow-up appointments, and if specific times were not offered or accepted.
rules.action: Ask about their preferred time or day for an appointment.
rules.example: Now, regarding your appointment, what days or times work best for you?

rules.title: Assess Appointment Urgency
rules.condition: Patient provides vague or no specific preferred appointment timing.
rules.action: Ask if they are experiencing any discomfort or if the appointment is urgent.
rules.example: I understand. Are you experiencing any discomfort or pain that would make this appointment urgent?

rules.title: Acknowledge Customer Input
rules.condition: Customer provides information or answers a question.
rules.action: Acknowledge their response to confirm understanding and show engagement.
